page.title: 03COASTAL WORK,WADE MARSH IOT
page.content: Following the inundation by the sea in 1953 when most of the area was covered by floods resulting from breaks in the then sea walls, the whole area has been protected by a new sea wall surmounted by a roadway. There is a drift along this North facing coast and the wall is protected from the effect of this by groynes and shingle infill. There is provision by sluices and gates for the discharge of water at low tide. The defences are maintained by the Southern Water Authority. They are also responsible for the small Sewage Works, a maceration plant, which may possibly be phased out in the future (1986?).
